dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE WIDE on this darkly lit office. A giant glass wall overlooks the bright, city lights of Phoenix, Arizona. Standing in the middle of the room is a MAN that we can't identify. He holds a gun in his hands, clutching it tightly.

dialogues.speaker: WE ARE CENTERED ON A WHITE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: OFFICIALS, suddenly rush around the corner. They're holding a few folders, walking briskly...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: He's ready-

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: -Full confession?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Full confession.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: He wants total immunity. They turn the corner and enter a small dark room, where a light shines over a MAN at a table. WE NEVER SEE the man' The three men pull up chairs across from him. One of them pulls out a small recording device, sets it u front of the man.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Someone went to work on that eye. The man doesn't respond. Official #2 reaches over and hits record on the recording device.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Okay...tell us what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other man continues to clutch the gun, staring out at city. Finally, in one swift movement, he raises it to his head fires... ROLL OPENING CREDITS. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys, LEVI CHARLES, TRAVIS HOWARD, ANDREW THOMAS, and ADAMS sit around a conference table, talking to JEFF REYN an older man in his late 50's with short, white hair.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We're an exclusive group here, Jeffrey. Do you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I guess so-

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: -How long have I known you?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: About...four years.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Okay. No offense, but the only reason we are talking right now is because I've built a rapport with you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We have twenty other people that want to meet with us but we're sitting here with you.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: We don't let just anyone invest with us.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: We're trying to maintain an image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Someone's gonna get rich. It might as well be you.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Do you understand what this opportunity is? I mean, do you truly understand what this opportunity is?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Tell'em Billy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: We will all but guarantee ten percent back on your investment in the first month.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: In the first month?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: The first month, Jeffrey. You have to realize...there is a reason that we are some of the most sought after brokers in the country right now. It's because we've created our brand. The Phoenix Group brand. And it stands for strength, reliability and consistency.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I just don't like how the minimums-

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: -There's only a minimum so we can know that you are serious about the investment. Serious about the commitment.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Look-If you feel uncomfortable after a few months and you want your money back, you can just pull out, and that'll be it.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: But you won't. Because after you see the returns you're getting in the first two months, you'll be dying to give us more money.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Do you know how our site works, Jeffrey?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, let me break it down really quick. We have implemented a system, utilizing the internet, that allows our investors to constantly keep track of their net gains. Billy here is the computer whiz that created it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It's set up so that you can look at your account at any time, and actually see where your money is going. You will be fully aware of any fluctuation. Complete transparency.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: And I'1l have access to that account? He looks at each man and then over to Levi. He flashes a grin.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No, Jeffrey. But let me assure you...it's in safe hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luxurious high-rise, overlooking the lights of Phoenix, Arizona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN LIGHTING CIGARS, smiling, wearing expensive cut Levi admires his cigar and proclaims...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Welcome to the twenty-first century, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERTITLE APPEARS AT THE BOTTOM OF THE SCREEN THAT
dialogues.text: January 1st, 2000.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Feels good.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: This is our time. This is our time to define what the twenty-first century is going to represent. Wecan shape it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: The first outlaws of the new millennium.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I get to be Wyatt Earp.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Fuck that, Andrew. I'm Wyatt.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No, you're more of a side kick. You're more of a Doc Holliday.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I get to be Billy the Kid...cuz... well...my name's Billy... He grins.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Nice reasoning, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, Billy the Kid died when he was twenty-one. You still wanna be him?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: suits.

dialogues.speaker: READS
dialogues.text: Well I’m still alive, aren’t I?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: No way I'm Doc Holliday.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just live with it, Travis. Levi steps back and grandly says...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'm Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Jesse James wasn't black.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You can't be Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm the black Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Doesn't work like that.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Fuck yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're gonna have to be... well...you're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm Jesse James because I say I am.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Whatever, Levi.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So we've decided? Billy is Billy. Travis is Doc. Levi is Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Black Jesse James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Jesse James. And I'm Wyatt Earp.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: And what are we called?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I think we're more of a Rat Pack if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: That's not gonna work because everyone wants to be Sinatra.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: And Levi won't wanna be Sammy Davis.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'd be Sinatra.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Black Sinatra?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Look--How about we just all shut the fuck up and get down to business, huh? I wanna get back to the point I was trying to make. Everyone quiets down...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen--We can define this century. The internet is allowing us to do things we've never done before. It's allowing us...to do what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Scamming the shit outta people.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We are not "scamming" people.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How is it different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because...these people will never feel the affects of losing their money. All we're doing is searching for oil, and when we find it, we extract a small, insignificant share.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Well, insignificant to them.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: These people. .how many people we have already?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Seventeen! Okay, clearly, they're all fucking millionaires. They give us that one hundred thousand...like Peter Williams did...they give us that one hundred thousand knowing its just going to sit in that account and accumulate cash flow. It's money they never plan on touching in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We are taking money from people that already have it...people that plan on dying rich...and we're giving it to the new generation...us!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Gotta keep it going is all.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Gotta keep it going.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Gotta stay out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will...as long as we communicate...collaborate...and continue finding investors. This isn't going to work if we let up. Seventeen is good. It is. But it's not eighteen. And eighteen isn't nineteen. And nineteen isn't motherfucking twenty.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: I think getting that call room was a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We hired anyone yet?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: We hired the main manager, not the telemarketers.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Okay, well we gotta get on that.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm still against it.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, before it was just private investors we met through connections. Now it's cold calls? I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: But the problem is we ran outta connections, Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: It's fine. Anything gets fishy...ever...all we do is get rid of the call room.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Okay, gentlemen. Time to roll. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: A SHOT OF EACH MAN AS THEY WALK.
dialogues.text: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed casino. Travis is sitting down at the Texas Hold'e table, looking over his cards. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I'm all-in. He pushes his chips into the middle of the table, and pul a cigarette. He whips out a lighter but before he can lig it...

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: No smoking, sir.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: The most nerve-racking game in the world, you can't fuckin' smoke? The man across from him, contemplates his call, and...

dialogues.speaker: GAMBLER
dialogues.text: I call. Travis looks shocked. The man flips his cards over and shows pocket Kings. Trav is beat. He freaks out...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: FUCK! You're slow playing Kings! You fuckin' bitch! Travis has a gambling problem to say the least...  cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, dressed in a suit and tie, sits across from his fa MR. ADAMS, a foreboding man of great stature.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ADAMS
dialogues.text: You are doing well for yourself, son.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Thanks, father.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ADAMS
dialogues.text: But you know, your line of work can fluctuate immensely. Billy grins...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Well...not necessarily...

dialogues.speaker: MR. ADAMS
dialogues.text: What I'm trying to say is...I want you to go to Law School.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Law School?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ADAMS
dialogues.text: Everyone in our family...it's your rite of passage, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ADAMS
dialogues.text: Look at your brother. You know how much money he's making right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew is sitting indian-style on the bed with his new girlfriend, HEATHER. They're playing a card game and also playing "would you rather" at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Would you rather have one arm or one leg? She responds quickly... She slaps She slaps

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: One arm. a card down...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Higher. the next card down.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Fly or teleport?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Fly, no question. Lower. You know, we're supposed to be taking shots in this game I think.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Eight feet tall or two feet tall? She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Two feet?! Umm....eight feet tall, easy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: How is that easy?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: It just is.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Higher.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, I have a good one.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather...be rich and die young...or be broke and die old... He looks at her closely...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Good question. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: UP THE VOLUME.
dialogues.text: Levi steps back from the stereo, wearing a wife-beater, j He looks really high, and is nodding his head to the beat the music with his eyes closed. He does that for a moment then comes back over to the couch and plops down. He leans over the coffee table and starts rolling a blunt weed. He continues nodding his head, the music flowing through He zones out. We pull back...leaving him alone...in isolation...and finally...

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our four guys are shaking hands with two ASIAN BUSINESSME exchange "goodbyes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men walk out of a doorway and wander through the garage...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Great work, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You think they're in?  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't know. They seemed pretty damn skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No, no, no. We got ‘em. Trust me. We wait two days, then call them back. We'll get it. Billy, I liked that thing you said about "risk."

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Guys...I just don't...I don't know...I feel like we should be going after some bigger fish here. I mean...these guys...maybe they invest our minimum...but I'm not trying to nickel and dime this shit. I want the big run, the big hit.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: The big hit is how we get fucked! The big hit is how we get the SEC all over our backs.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Hold on, holdon. Travis--Do you have something in mind?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You got someone, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Who? Travis contemplates bringing this up, but finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy...Tan'el.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Tan'el?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Tan'el Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Is this that Mexico City connection?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No--Screw that guy!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What? I haven't heard about this.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Travis met some guy playing-

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: -Can I speak for myself? Andrew bites his lip, steps back. Travis prepares his story and then delivers...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, I was playing in this underground hold'em tournament, exclusive shit, fifty thousand dollar buy in. Atlantic city about two months ago. Well, I'm hot, seriously fuckin' hot. I'm check raising blind before the flop and hitting. Just pure magic, man.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, I'm the chip leader and people are starting to take notice. After awhile, they combine a few tables, and I get put next to this big fuckin' Carlos Santana motherfucker, chest  hair, gold chains, sunglasses, the whole damn archetype man. This guy just smells like money. So, we start this little convo. And the whole time, I'm pitching myself as a broker, playing it off like I'm fuckin' Gordon Gekko and shit. But, we aren't playing against each other, until finally I hit big and go all-in. Well, this fucker calls me, flips over a damn straight flush. A straight fuckin' flush. I lose everything. As I'm walking away, he pulls me aside and says..."I'1ll give you a chance to make some of that back." He slides me his card and says “you make it to my city, we'll talk business." Talkin' about Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Perfect. Great lead.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Finish the story, Travis.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Well, it turns out, this guy runs the largest drug operation in Mexico, and isn't even allowed in the U.S.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Geez, Travis.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: But this guy...he's a big fish. Fuckin' Moby Dick, man!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Scamming these middle-aged Republicans is one thing but you gotta be insane to fuck with a drug lord. We could be negotiating, and out of nowhere this guy could think somethin's up and fuckin' kill us!

dialogues.speaker: DREAM SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: Tan'el sits across from our four guys. He gives a scowl in SLOW-MOTION whips out a 9mm, stands and BLASTS ALL OF

dialogues.speaker: GUYS IN THE CHEST, ONE BY ONE, BLOOD IGNITING FROM THEIR
dialogues.text: and QUICKLY CUT BACK TO REALITY...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, that's the debate then, isn't it? Billy, wat'd you say in there about risk again?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Basically just...no risk, no reward. No big risk, no big reward.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No big risk, no big reward. He smiles. Andrew looks around at the others and notices the only one who is nervous about this. They stand in silence for a moment. MUSIC CUE TAKING US TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are sitting on a private plane, wearing suits, c sunglasses, traveling to...Mexico City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane lands on a private runway outside of Mexico Cit four men are met by a private limousine. They get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up to a huge ranch estate. The four men ge wearing their suits, looking sharp. Billy takes off his sunglasses...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Chill Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large surveillance van probably two miles away. There are F.B.I. officials sitting around a tracking and recording device, surveillance video. They're drinking coffee. One of the men sips his drink and burns his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Fuck that's hot! MIKE NORTHCUTT, a strong, intelligent man, will become a figure in the story...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean you told me, you didn't say shit.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I told you! Didn't I say something, Dan? I said "cool it off."

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: I don’t need any advice froma fuckin’ rookie.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Rookie? Where?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Right..(he points at him) there.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please..I was in the field for ten years before they begged me to help out on your unit.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That’s not subjective, that’s a mother fuckin’ fact. He reaches into his pocket and takes out some nicorette g He pops a piece into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Nicorette?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: You’re really losing your edge. Mike doesn’t react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys are being led through the house by a hired ASSIS This place is a palace, the product of drug money. Billy and Andrew are looking around, admiring the place. and Travis walk ahead of them, staring straight forward. They turn the corner to see TAN'EL GARCIA, 40's, overweig watching a movie, holding his young nephew in his lap. He their footsteps and turns...

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Gentlemen! He moves his nephew to the side and gets up...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Mr. Garcia.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Great to meet you. They all shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all sit around this huge dining room table. Tan'el' assistant wanders around with a cigar box and offers one of them. They each take one and put it to their lips.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Been hittin' any of the tables lately? Tan'el laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Of course! And if you want your money taken again, lemme know.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: (grinning) Any time, any place. Tan'el laughs again. The assistant wanders around once more and lights each ci He grows serious, wanting to get down to business.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: So talk to me, talk to me, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, how much do you know about us?

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Our job is to make you money.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You provide the capitol, and we provide the interest.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Heavy interest.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We guarantee returns.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Guarantee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask any one of our partners and you'11l hear the same thing. We do not bullshit. We are in the business of making money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike has his headphones on, listens intently to the conversation. He turns up the volume on his mixer.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Who are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We have connections, relationships we've developed, that allow us and help assist us to predict the market and make the calculated decisions necessary to put benjamins in your pocket.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuckin' insider trading?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You at least know our track record, right? Travis filled you in?

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. He pumped you guys up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So, you're aware of our reputation then?

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Okay, then before we go further, what kinds of questions and concerns do you have about the process?  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Well...you know...I work hard for my money. I work for twenty years to get to where I am. Twenty years. Twenty years of gathering, accumulating...wealth, power...to get to where I am today. To get all of this! So, now that I am here, now that I am on the pedestal, as you will, I don't plan on jumping off. I plan on staying up on my fucking pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Of course-

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: -Do you know how I stay on my pedestal? By making good decisions. By making the right decisions. I don't partner with people, rule number one. I don't trust anyone. I don't get fucked, rule number two.

dialogues.text: They have thousands of registered traders to worry about-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -You want my contact list of investors? You can have it. Every one of them will tell you about the deposits they get from us every month.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But is it bigger than their investment is my question.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Well, Mr...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Northcut.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Northcut. Why don't you write me a check and find out?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No? Okay, then, if you wanna talk further, you know where to find me...at the fuckin' coffee shop trying to fuckin' relax. Good day to you. He slides out and walks away. Mike seems frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy walks quickly down the street. He's thinking hard, breathing hard, stops in his tracks, and looks back in th direction of the coffee shop. He bites his bottom lip, an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew is on the phone, having a consultation with a lead

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Sir, we are in the business of making money. That's what we do. Would you like to talk to some of my other clients? To confirm the returns they're getting as we speak?  Billy walks in, Andrew holds up his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I understand. Well, then let me talk to your wife about it. (pause) Yes, that's fine. Call anytime. (pause) But Rick, remember, you're dealing with the champs here. You're dealing with Andrew Thomas! If you were smart, you'd tell your wife that if she wants that anniversary in the Bahamas this year, you should do something with your money and allow us to help you. (pause) Okay, Rick. I'1l have my phone on me at all times. Bye now. He hangs up, then holds his cell phone like a gun, pointi at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are in the old west, Billy. And this here, is my damn pistol. He spins it around in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're the cowboys, baby. Modern age cowboys. Billy comes over and sits down across from Andrew. Andrew sits down and starts doing some paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: We are in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: And I have the quickest draw in the West.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Faster than Levi?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Eh. So what's up? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew...I was down gettin' some coffee this morning...and some F.B.I. official approached me. Andrew freezes, looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: He wanted me to give him information and said that I'd get total immunity and all this shit. He takes out Mike's business card and flips it onto Andre desk.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're investigating us, man. They're onto us!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Calm down. (a beat) See, we're making money now. Lots of money. And people don't like that. They don't wanna see young guys making more than they do.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: He was like "you're gonna get caught." Andrew ponders...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: This is okay. He wants to talk to someone? Send him up to my office next time this guy approaches you.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes. There's nothing to pin on us.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: This just got me thinking...I don't know...how long...  He stops. Andrew leans in...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Say what you wanna say, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna get caught, Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Knock that off, right now!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I just-

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: -First off, you knew what you were getting into when you got involved. You have to believe one hundred percent in this or it falls through...or the pyramid crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I know, I know...this guy...just kind of shook me up a little bit. Before I thought we were untouchable- Suddenly, Levi walks in...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Andrew, you call that last lead? He sees the mood...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ANDEW
dialogues.text: (bluntly) Billy wants to quit. What?! No...I... Levi looks at him sternly...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You wanna fucking quit?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No, I just said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him what you just told me. Billy nervously stands up, takes a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: The fuckin' F.B.I. talked to me, man. F.B.I. Levi contemplates...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What'd you say to them?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: It was just one guy. I told him to fuck off, what'd you think?!

dialogues.speaker: LEV
dialogues.text: Okay, okay...this is fine. I don't know what triggered this but this is fine.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: And I didn't say I wanna quit, I just said...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, I'll clear that up for you right now...this is amafia, Bill. And like all mafias, you can't quit, you can't...it's for life. Blood in, blood out kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I would never think about quitting.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Remember, we are defining the 21st century right now, as we speak. We are defining the age of technology with this. Jesse James, remember?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: So are you cool?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You're cool?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Okay...now...let's make some phone calls, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Billy gets up and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: And that F.B.I. official approaches you again, you tell him Levi wants to talk to him! Andrew picks up Mike's business card on his desk and star it. cut TO: EXT. NORTHCUTT’s MODEST HOME — EVENING Mike parks his car in the driveway, grabs his briefcase a wanders over the front door. INT. NORTHCUTT’s MODEST HOME —

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Becky?! He tosses his suitcase onto the living room couch, takes his jacket and heads into the kitchen. He calls out again...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Becky?! You home?! He pauses, waits for an answer, and then quickly opens up cabinet drawer and takes out a handle of Jack Daniels. He a glass and starts pouring. A smile comes on his fact, h pouring, takes a big swig. It doesn’t go down smooth and he winces. We HEAR footsteps from the other room... Mike quickly tries to hide the alcohol but Becky turns th and sees him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Hey, honey, are- Mike freezes.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you were quitting?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Baby...I had a rough, rough, day. A tough, tough day.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: A promise is a promise, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Look—I haven’t had a cig in weeks. Can’t we take this one at a time?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It was your idea to quit! I agreed of course, but you can’t just back out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your right. Well, how about I quit next week? I need something to keep me going. I need something to keep my blood boiling. He walks over to her and puts his hands on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m chasing some bad people right now. But I don’t think anyone believes me. They think I’m wrong..but I’m not..and I’m gonna prove it.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: So you get to drink because of that?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Travis is playing hold'em. Billy wanders up behind him...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey Travis, I think I'm taking off, okay?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You gonna taxi home?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Sure. (to the table) Ten thousand. Travis stacks some chips and slides them into the middle table. A few other players fold, but finally, this other guy cal him...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got some action, okay. The DEALER starts flipping over the cards, and finally, T wins.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah! Travis jumps up and starts pumping his fist, celebrating more than he should.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Too bad, baby, time to walk! The other PLAYER is getting annoyed by this taunting.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you gonna cry little baby? You a little baby? C'mon, you set yourself up for that shit. The Player makes a bee line for Travis and gets up in his

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chill the fuck out.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You're lucky I don't break your nose right now. Travis scowls and looks away...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Can someone get this guy a piece of gum, fuck. The Player shoves Travis in the chest and he flies back! rest of the players get up and try to break it up. Travis back at him but is stopped by Billy.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You better watch your back! I fuckin' know people man! I could buy you right now! You know how much money I have?! Huh?! The scuffle continues, Billy thrown in the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy drives down the road. Travis in shotgun. They aren' saying anything to each other. cut TO: EXT. MANSION — DAY A young female REAL ESTATE AGENT leads Andrew and Heather to a beautiful home...

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: I think you’ll love this one. Andrew grabs Heathers hand, they smile at each other.  INT. MANSION — They wander into the home and it is gorgeous to say the l

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: This was actually just put on the market. Perfect for a young, rich couple like yourself. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: How do you know we’re rich? Do I smell like money or something? He smiles and sniffs his shirt as a joke.

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: I think I know when you asked to look at houses in the two to five million dollar range!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes of course.

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: How long have you been married?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We're not.

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: Oh, how long have you been engaged? They don’t say anything, awkward moment, until...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: This place is beautiful. Heather walks out and over to the kitchen. Andrew follows

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: I’1l give you a chance to check it out. They wander away from her and over into the kitchen. INT. KITCHEN, MANSION —

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I like the kitchen. But if this place has any secret passageways I’m signing today! Suddenly, his phone rings. ANDREW (CONT’D) I gotta take this.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I thought you said you weren’t gonna answer your phone?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Baby, please, I have to. This is important.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well so is this! Andrew looks back and forth at Heather and then his phone and forth and finally he whips open his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hey...yeah..what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi, Andrew, and Billy sit around a conference table...a looking very serious. Suddenly, Travis walks into the room, kind of dishevled, his suit.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. The others look at each other.  Travis takes his seat. They all look at him. Travis feels uncomfortable...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Levi leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, about what?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You're drawing too much attention to yourself...to us.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I don't wanna lecture you, Travis...but...we don't need any extra attention from anyone. People hear you talking about how much money you have, they're going to start getting interested into where that money is coming from.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Our cover is completely credible.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, Travis. We can't seem reckless.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You a little tattle-tale, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Leave him out of this.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay, so what do you want me to say?!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Just take it easy for a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just be smart. Use common sense. Travis takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shit...alright, fine. You gonna take my gambling priviledges away too?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Gamble all you fuckin' want. Lose your entire share if it makes you happy.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You know what, fuck you, Levi. You always act like you're the leader, but let me tell you something, there is no fucking leader!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they're arguing, Richard wanders up the hallway, going to ask them a question. He hears Travis shouting, and stops by the door.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You wanna be in charge, Travis?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: That's my fucking point! No one is in charge! We're a fucking team!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Travis, just chill out.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: We get busted, we all go down together. Together. No one is different here. And I might as well point something else out...this  whole fucking scam was my idea! The fake accounts, the Ponzi scheme!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Sit your ass back down and shut your mouth!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: I was the one who thought this shit up, man! And don't forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is listening closely now, looks confused, squints passes over the doorway, blocking a little bit of light g into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys continue to argue as Billy watches the doorway.. the light in the doorway kind of flickering because of Ri He watches more closely and finally jumps up and rips ope door. He sees Richard, grabs him and throws him into the

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What the- Immediately Andrew and Billy toss him into a chair. They gather around him...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you just hear?! Richard is freaked out...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Nothing, nothing. I was just walking by.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Bullshit! Travis wanders away, rubbing his head in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Richard...be smart here...tell us what you heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I didn't...hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You're lying, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: How long were you standing there?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Just for like...a minute.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: A minute! You can hear a lot ina minute, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Dammit! Andrew walks away. Levi contemplates...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We gotta kill him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What?! He tries to jump up but Billy and Andrew grab him again a his arms behind his back as he continues to squirm. Levi bends down right in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Richard...tell me...what would you do right now?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. We have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don't care what you're doing, I dont...I won't tell anyone...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So you did hear something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the end.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Tell me what you heard, Richard. Tell me what you heard and we'll think about not killing you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I just...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Time to talk, c'mon.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I just heard Travis, say, the thing about the fake accounts. Travis turns to the group...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You're right...we do have to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Guys, guys, please...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go get my gun, I'll be right back. He turns for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You have a gun?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Hell yeah I have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: For shit like this, what you think?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You're just gonna shoot him right here?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Yes! One shot and it's done. He holds his hand like a gun and points it at Richard AND

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What would we do with the body?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We'll carry his ass outta here and dump it somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hold on. Let's figure this out first.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: There's nothing to figure out! He knows! He knows! He knows! He knows! He leaves this room and we're all dead!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Who am I gonna tell?-

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: -Richard, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How about we just...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Just what?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't know. This is tough.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No, this isn't tough. This is an easy decision in my book.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You don't think anyone's gonna be curious why he disappeared?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Not if we do it right.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Everyone knows I work here...people will know what happened... Levi jumps back over to Richard and talks an inch from hi face...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Say one more word...c'mon...say one more... Richard freezes. Levi goes back over to Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We can't kill him. The F.B.I.'s all over us right now anyway, we don't need to give them another reason to talk to us. Levi looks back over at Richard...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: How about this... He walks over to him, talks in a quiet, calm voice...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you tell anyone, if...if...if... you better fuckin' run...you better find a fuckin' rock and hide behind it for the rest of your life because I will hunt you down...I will hunt you down Richard...got it?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Got it, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You gonna say anything?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Alright...now...go back to work. Richard gets up and runs out of the room. They all look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: This is a problem.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I think we should like...tap his phones or something... Levi nods...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea. A beat. Travis looks over at them...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Sorry guys...nothing like that will ever happen again...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Damn right. There's an awkward tension in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP ON -- A stereo plays a SONG. Heather is in the kitchen, moving to the beat as she rea into a cabinet and pulls out a bottle of wine. She hums t song, uncorks the bottle, and pours a glass of wine. Andrew wanders in behind her, watches her for a moment... She turns and is startled by him...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh shit, Andrew. You scared me. Andrew is still wearing his suit, but his tie is undone. smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Wine.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I know it's wine. What year?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Oh. She examines the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ninety five...Napa Valley...pinot. I thought it would add a little something to the meal. She nods toward the kitchen table. She's prepared a nice for both of them. Andrew smiles, but clearly exhausted from the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit across from each other, not saying much, but mak eye contact here and there.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How was work today? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just okay? That's it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It was...interesting. Everyday is interesting working with those guys.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Working with those psychos?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hey, those are my business partners you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I've met your business partners...and they're psychos.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: As psycho as wanting to bury a million dollars in the ground?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No, that's strategy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Strategy?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Yes! You're gonna thank me for that one day!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Are you in a bad mood?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well, is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just stressed out...very, very stressed out.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's getting harder and harder to kind of...turn off work...in my head. It's hard to come home and not think about all the stuff I had to go through...and all the stuff I have to deal with tomorrow...and the next day...it just keeps...building...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Do you need help with anything?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (smiles) No, but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: So why don't you take a little vacation?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I can't...this job...making the type of money I'm trying to make...is an all-day, everyday endeavor...it never stops... They look at each other and sit in silence... MUSIC COMES IN AND CONTINUES TO PLAY OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We show a bunch of scenes where all of our guys are talki the phones with investors, closing deals, Levi pacing the room, Monica half-naked in bed as Levi walks into the roo Andrew and Billy shaking hands with other investors, Andr Heather kissing in bed, Travis collecting more chips at t casino, the montage ends with the four guys sitting in ch smoking cigars, the image of success.  Taking us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all sitting in oversized, brown, leather chairs, smoking cigars at this low key lounge...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Gentlemen--We have tripled our client roster.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Now be smart with what you spend your money on.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Why you looking at me?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah I bet. Well, when we first started this thing, I honestly thought it'd be difficult.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Sayin' shit like that's gonna fuckin' jinx us, man!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
