dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good, good. Almost as good as me!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy is still hanging out in the office. He looks at his then gets up, grabs his jacket, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew is holding the gun now, looking down the sight. He fires...misses...fires...misses.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You suck, Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Shut up. He lowers the gun...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This seems like a pretty good bargaining tool.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: It is, it is. I use it in all my negotiations! They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So...you have my money? Silence...a beat.  Finally...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, that's why we wanted to come down here.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We really want you to continue to work with us.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: I already explained this. I need that money.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Let's try to figure something out that works for both of us. Tan'el calmly reaches out for the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: (quietly) Can I see that for a moment? Andrwe hands it to him. Tan'el quickly grabs it and points it right at Levi's hea

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me my money. Levi nervously smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, hands in his pockets, wanders down the street. He passes a deli, stops, and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Everyone is a good shot when they're standing an inch from their target. I don't think I can miss from here.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just calm down, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: I made a mistake. I was too quick to invest with you gentlemen. Too stupid.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We can make you money. Just give us time.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: No! If my money is not in my account by next weekend...I will kill you. Is that clear? Is that English? I can tell you in Spanish if you want?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, this wasn't much of a negotiation, was it?

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Give us two weeks. And just the rest of the capitol.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Why two weeks? Why more time?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We have to organize our accounts.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Yeah, crunch some numbers.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Okay, two weeks. He lowers the gun and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy looks over the menu, orders, pays, and takes his se a table about ten feet away. He's looking at his cell pho As he's looking at his phone, a MAN enters through the fr entrance. Billy hears him, but doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Walter, how ya doin'? Billy finally looks up, sees Walter and does a double tak recognizes him and realizes he's going by a different nam

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: (smirking) Hey, Jonathan... Walter snaps his head over to him, gives a surprised expr and quickly turns back to the cashier. Billy flashes a huge smile, knows he was spying on them.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Levi walk down the runway. Levi has his phone to his ear...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Billy, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You guys landed yet?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We're just taking off. Be there in a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Okay...well...when you land...I need you guys to come over to my house.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I'll explain when you get here. He hangs up.  Levi lowers the cell phone, looks oddly over at Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up to the front door and knock. After only a mo Billy rips the door open, he's biting his nails.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So what's going, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I have to show you something. The guys look confused. Billy turns and leads them throug house and over to a bedroom. They open the door next to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting there on the far side of the room is Walter, a bl around his eyes, his mouth bleeding, and his arms tied be his back. Andrew quickly slams the door shut again...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That's Walter, man.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Walter?!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: He's F.B.I. He was spying on us.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Remember Jonathan Mitchell? The investor of that accounting firm we met last week?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: That's him!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: So why the hell is he tied up in your house, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I didn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Andrew walks away, rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Billy, Billy...listen to me for a second. Did anyone see you bring this guy here?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Are you sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yes, positive.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I was thinking I was gonna save our asses by catching a spy!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: But Billy...what do we do now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where’s Travis? Does he know about this?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: He didn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Billy...I appreciate you looking out for us. I know you thought this was the right thing to do, but this was not the right thing to do. This was the wrong thing to do. Billy rubs his eyes. Andrew opens the door again and studies Walter...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Is he knocked out?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so. I hit him pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: So let's just dump him somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Then he'll just come back and arrest us.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: No, no. I blindfolded him right away, he doesn't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Will he recognize you from our company?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You don't think so?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah. He only saw me for a moment. He probably won't remember anything.  Andrew closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We need to worry about Tan'el right now, we don't have time to think about a freaking hostage!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Billy's gonna handle this.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You're gonna fuckin' dump him back off somewhere, somewhere in this desert so no one sees your ass doing it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: walright...okay.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Got it?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, got it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Somebody call Travis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet until...Billy's flies by and screeches to a No one is around. Billy quickly jumps out and walks around to the side of t He opens the door, grabs Walter by the arms and drags him into the desert.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What the hell?! You better run! You're going to jail for a long time, son! His blindfold is still on, he has no clue who Billy is...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Sure about that? Billy jumps into the driver's seat and takes off. Walter tries to get to his feet, but trips and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guys sit around the room. Andrew's pacing back and forth. Travis is there.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Tan'el... No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: There's nothing we can do with him. We have to bite the bullet on this one. Cut our spending and continue to push forward, finding more people. We haven't even asked any clients to refer us yet. We should work those connections more. A beat...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Tan'el...what if...what if we killed him...kept the money.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin' serious? Levi get you on that coke or what?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: First of all, fuck off. Secondly, that's not a bad idea, Travis. Billy doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Are you insane?!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You wouldn't kill him for ten million dollars?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No! What the-where the hell am I?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: It's definitely intriguing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Intriguing?! You plan to just walk in there, say "hey, howya' doin?" and then cap his ass? You don't think anyone's gonna have a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, obviously, we'd be smarter about it than that.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What would you do for ten million dollars, Andrew? He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (overly articulate) What would you do for ten million dollars, Andrew? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Shit...I don't know! Not murder!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Then I'll do it, or Levi, or Billy.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: We see Tan'el smoking a cigar, laughing, and then Levi, and Billy come up behind him. Levi draws a gun and POINTS AT HIM. ON THE SOUND OF THE TRIGGER WE CUT BACK TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You stay here, be a pussy.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't consider that being a pussy you head-case. I consider that rational thinking.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Travis is right though...you don't have to be involved.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm involved no matter what, so stop saying that. If I know about it, and I don't stop it, I'm involved.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: I just don't see any other way.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: How about giving him his money back? (a beat) We wire him his ten mill, we suck it up, and move on. We haven't spent that much of it any way.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I gotta get out of here. I'm not having this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Now you quitting? Andrew stops... A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mockingly) You can't quit, right? This isa mafia...blood in... No one responds. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: You don't really wanna murder Tan'el, do you? Travis leans back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: I think it should be an option.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I'm worried about Andrew, I am.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You don't need to be.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't know...I mean...I thought I was feelin' skeptical but Andrew...I think everything's starting to get to him. What if he tells someone?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Well, then we'll probably know about it.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: (frankly) I tapped his phones and miked his house.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: What? Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No. I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Wait-You tap my shit?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You're a liar.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I didn't, Travis! I trust you. Andrew, I don't trust. Not lately.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't like that, man. That's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I'm lookin' out for us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: When did you tap his phones?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Same time I did Richard's. If he's so trust worthy then we should have nothing to worry about, right? Levi's point kind of makes sense. The group sits in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather sits on the floor, looking at some CD's. She pops one into the stereo and turns it upa little bit. Andrew walks in the front door. He's slouching, looks tir Heather hears him...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Hey baby. He wanders into the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Just listening to some music. He collapses onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Some day, I bet we won't even have CD's.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, first we had records, then tapes, now CD's, I mean it's the year two thousand, I'm sure they're gonna think of something.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Maybe like a little CD player, but it has all your music without putting any CD's in.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: That's just crazy. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Wasn't it weird how everyone thought Y2K was gonna be the end of the world? Everyone bought all this canned food, searched for bomb shelters, and then the clock struck midnight and nothing fuckin' happened. Nothing. How can people be so wrong about something? Just completely wrong.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I was worried.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No way! You were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little bit. You weren't?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You know, you think you're a tough guy, but I know you're really just a big baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (playfully) Dem's fightin' words.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I could take you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Really, huh? She gets up and jumps on him. They wrestle for a moment and it ends with Andrew holding

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: So, where are we having the wedding? We haven't even decided yet. Andrew grows serious...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How about...Jamaica? He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, not Jamaica. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We might have to push it back for awhile. She perks up and turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well...we had some...problems...at work.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What kind of problems?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We lost some money. Heather looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't wanna get into it...but... I just want you to know that I'm trying to give you the wedding of your dreams...I wanna make sure it's perfect. So I'm going to need more time.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what happened? He takes another breath...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Remember that big investment we got? Well, we lost it.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You lost it? How?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We had to give it back. He gets up and starts pacing, getting increasingly stress

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really didn't wanna talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: If we're going to get married, I deserve to know everything about your life, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You can talk to your wife, Andrew. What are you hiding?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm not hiding anything.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Sure sounds like it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's just...complicated...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I want to trust you. I have to trust you...you have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Then tell me what's going on. He turns to her. He's about to crack.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Everything I do...I'm not perfect...I've made mistakes...but I think...I don't know...I'm sick of being the bad guy.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Bad guy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What I'm about to tell you, you can't repeat, you can't question, and I want you to know that I'm trying to make it right. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Okay. You can trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can trust you?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Of course. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, I'm telling you this because I love you too. I love you more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Just tell me. He walks over and sits down next to her...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Our company...baby...our company is a fucking fraud. We don't invest, we're not stock brokers, we're frauds! What we do...we take peoples investments and then pay them back small portions of their own money pretending it's their interest. But there is no fucking interest! We're spending their money!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: But...how...wouldn't you run out?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Not if you keep getting investors! Especially if the investments keep getting bigger! And we keep getting them! Baby...we're stealing their money! This house is stolen! Everything in here! Everything I buy you! It's all a scam, baby! He gets up and starts pacing. He notices she's starting to get nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But Heather...see...the only reason I'm telling you this is because I'm gonna stop, I'm quitting, I'm not gonna be a criminal anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if someone finds out?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No one's gonna find out, ever. No one knows. No one will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I think you should tell someone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: And go to jail?! Are you insane?!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Are they gonna let you just walk away? Andrew ponders...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No, not exactly. I'm still figuring that out. Heather starts to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heather--Don't cry. Everything's gonna be fine. Really. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I don't want anything to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nothing's gonna happen to me. We're going to be alright.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: How are you gonna protect yourself? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: There is one option...a backup plan...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: If all else fails, and I have to get out, if I need to do something drastic...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: There's this F.B.I. agent that's been trying to get information from us. He told us...he told Billy...that...he'd grant immunity to anyone who disclosed information about our company, if it lead to indictments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Heather lie in bed -- Andrew is awake and star up at the ceiling. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi is sitting under a street light, waiting. After a mo Travis and Billy wander up.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: So what's this about? Levi pauses for a moment. Travis looks around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We have a problem with Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: What kind of problem?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: A big problem...a really big problem.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I have something I want you to hear. Levi walks toward the office building. Travis and Billy look at each, and finally, follow Levi t the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brushes his teeth in front of the mirror, getting read a day of work. He takes an extra long look at himself in mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew, dressed in his suit, holding his suitcase, crosse through the parking garage. He seems nervous, breathing h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG TAKE -- He gets into the elevator, rides it up, gets and walks through the entire office. He passes Levi's off empty, passes Travis' office, empty, Billy's office, empt heads over to the conference room and opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi, Billy, and Travis sit around the conference table w serious expressions. They turn and stare at Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We having a meeting?  Levi nods. Andrew senses some tension in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: (calmly) Can you close the door? Andrew closes the door. As he does, Levi stands up and smoothly takes out a gun a it right at Andrew's back. He turns around to see the gun freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Sit down. Andrew puts his hands up and wanders over to a chair. He sits down and Travis immediately whips out some duct t rips off a large piece and slaps it across Andrew's mouth jerks up but Billy grabs his arms and holds them behind t chair. Travis takes the rest of the duct tape and starts wrapping it around his body and the chair. Levi leans in...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Andrew, Andrew, Andrew. We have a problem. Andrew fights for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know why we're doing this? He obviously can't respond...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we were brothers. I thought we were family. We had a circle of trust here, Andrew. But you know what you did? You broke that bond. You  broke the motherfuckin' trust circle, Andrew. Andrew's eyes look confused.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were gonna sell us out. You were gonna tell the F.B.I. and fuck us! He shakes his head furiously.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't deny that! I...hear...everything. I have tiny little eyeballs everywhere. This isn't easy for us, Andrew. This is hard....very, very hard. We don't wanna have to kill you...but...I think we have to. I think we have to kill your girl too. Andrew is breathing heavily, and in one big burst of stre tries to rip out of the duct tape. He kind of breaks some it, and Travis and Billy hold him back down.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Use more duct tape, shit. Billy holds him down as Travis applies more tape.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm wrong here. Maybe I shouldn't kill you. Do you have a better idea? A better option? Cuz we don't. We're not going to jail, Andrew. We're not gonna let you sell us out. Andrew is trying to say something, we hear it muffled by tape.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: Maybe we should let him say something. Levi thinks about it...finally...rips the duct tape off o mouth.  Andrew yells out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Talk, talk, talk.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (through breaths) I don't...know...what the hell you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Andrew...I miked your house.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I...miked...your...house. You were going to rat us out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What? No! No, I wasn't!

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We fucking heard you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I wasn't serious! I would never do that! He motions to Travis to cover his mouth up again. Travis does...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: No denying it now, sir. I'm sorry. Levi wanders over to the window.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've put us in a very difficult position. He clutches his gun in his hands, calmly walks over to An and WHACK! He hits him in the face with the back of his g and knocks him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew was in the back of a trunk, his face bruised and c His hands are tied behind his back and he still has duct over his mouth. Billy has just popped the trunk. They're on top of a parking garage, no other cars around. Billy is leaning up against the car. He takes out a cigarette and lights it. Andrew squirms for a moment and then realizes he can't fr himself.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY
dialogues.text: I don't know how we got here, man. I feel like I'm in a fucking nightmare...and I'm just waiting to wake up from this shit. (a beat) They're looking for Heather right now, Andrew. And me? I'm supposed to get rid of you. I'm supposed to kill you. I'm supposed to kill one of my best friends! Billy rubs his head. Andrew fights harder to untie himself but it's useless.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first outlaws of the 21st century, huh? It sounds romantic...but...all this shit... everything we've been doing for the last two years...it's all fucked up. We're all insane, you know that? To do what we've been doing? You have to be wired a little differently up here to go through with any of this stuff. You know...my goal...was always just about making money...make as much money as you can...make all the money in the world...prove to people and myself that I could do it. Why? Probably cuz it was important to my  parents, I guess. But, one day I finally realized that isn't what makes me happy. I still don't know what does though...I'm still trying to figure that out. (a beat) You're one of my best friends, Andrew. I could never kill you...I could never kill anyone. Levi? Travis? They could kill. They might have already killed her. I don't know. But...that's for you to figure out I guess. He tosses his cigarette away, reaches over and helps Andr of the trunk. Andrew's feet and hands are tied and he col onto the ground. Billy stands over him...

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, Andrew. Billy the Kid isn't gonna die young. Billy the Kid is running off into the sunset. You guys? I don't know what's going to happen. I don't wanna know. I don't wanna be here anymore. I wanna change, I wanna be somebody else, have a different life. He takes out a small knife and unties his feet and hands.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wyatt Earp, huh? Good luck, man. Take care of yourself. He tosses Andrew's cellphone into his lap, rushes over to driver's seat and gets in. Andrew jumps up and rips the d tape off his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Billy! Wait! Where are they?! Where are they?! He jogs after the car but Billy quickly peels away and is He stops and looks down at his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew dials Heather's number, and rushes down the stairs He listens for a moment, but the answering clicks on...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Fuck! He continues down the stairs. Dials again...answering mac He reaches the bottom of the stairs and takes off into a speed sprint. Mid-stride, he dials again... No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew runs along the city street, breathing hard, sweati scanning the area for a taxi. He sees one and darts into the street to flag it down. He his arms wildly into the air. The taxi slams on its brake cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi and Travis are parked across the street waiting in t car. Travis lights a cigarette. They wait, not talking to each other, Levi's eyes fixed o front door. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew is breathing hard, continues to dial her number an no answer. He reaches into his pocket, grabs his wallet and opens i takes out Mike's business card and looks at it. Finally, he dials the number.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hello? Mike Northcut? (pause) Yes, this is Andrew Thomas with the Phoenix Group. (pause) I have something to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi pulls up to his house and Andrew jumps out. He d pay the driver and just runs toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey! You owe me... He trails off as Andrew reaches the front door. He opens was unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Heather?! He jogs into the kitchen, no one. He jogs into the living

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi and Travis are standing there, Levi holding a gun... Andrew sees them and freezes...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shit! I told you I should do it! Levi doesn't respond to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Where's my wife?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: You tell me. We've been waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Where's Billy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What'd you mean "he left?"

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: He's gone! He bailed! He doesn't wanna be a part of this anymore... just like me. Levi raises his gun to Andrew...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Too bad. Andrew puts his hands up... Levi kind

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You think me and Billy are the only ones who wanted out? Travis was gonna do the same thing I was!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm serious, Levi! He said you were getting out of control. of looks over at Travis...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shoot him, please.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: He told Billy too! He always hated that you were the leader! Remember?!

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Gimme the gun, please, I'll shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: He's trying to save his ass, what'd you think?! Fucking kill him, man, and lets get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the truth, Levi! Ask Billy! It's true! He always hated how you were Jesse James and shit, the leader...isn't that right Travis?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Shut your fucking mouth, Andrew. Levi! Gimme the gun! He lunges for it, but Levi steps back and points it at hi They freeze there for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Maybe I should just kill both of you?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, fuckin' maybe. (a beat) You really gonna let him manipulate you like this? Are you that weak?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: I forgot...do I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You're so fucking paranoid, man. Travis takes out a cigarette and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to figure some shit out for yourself, because if you can't trust me, you can't trust anyone.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I can't trust anyone.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: You know...I always thought I had some problems...but...compared to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up to the side garage...and out steps Heather

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: Is this what you wanted, Andrew? You wanted this thing to self-destruct? We were on top of the world, you realize that?

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: We still are... Suddenly, Heather crosses into the living room, sees them standing there, and SCREAMS! Her high-pitched scream startles Levi and he SHOOTS TRAVI

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The bullet slices through Travis' chest, his cigarette dr from his mouth. In this instance, Andrew spins around, and grabs Heather.

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: Levi looks over at them but rushes over to Travis...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI
dialogues.text: Shit! Shit! Travis is coughing up blood, as Levi leans down next to h

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn't...mean...

dialogues.speaker: TRAVIS
dialogues.text: (coughing) This feels...pretty real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Heather run out to her car...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Gimme the keys! She tosses the keys to him, and they pile in. He fires up the car and they peel out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi gets up and runs out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi makes it outside in time to see Andrew and Heather d down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Heather drive down the street, Andrew pulls th over on the side of the road. He unbuckles his seat belt, over and they hug...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Baby, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I'm scared...what's going on...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's okay...everything is taken care of now...we're gonna be alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SCENE FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE MOVIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE WIDE on this darkly lit office. A giant glass wall overlooks the bright, city lights of Phoenix, Arizona. Standing in the middle of the room is a MAN, that we now as Levi. He is holding a gun in his hands...clutching it tightly.

dialogues.speaker: WE ARE CENTERED ON A WHITE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: OFFICIALS, suddenly rush around the corner. We now identify one of the men as Mike Northcut.  They're holding a few folders, walking briskly...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: He's ready-

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: -Full confession?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Full confession.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: He wants total immunity. They turn the corner and enter a small dark room, where a light shines over a MAN at a table, that we now identify Andrew. The three men pull up chairs across from him. One of them pulls out a small recording device, sets it u front of Andrew, and hits record.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Someone went to work on that eye. He doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve been chasing you guys for awhile now, huh? Still no response...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I always knew..I always knew. He reaches over and hits record on the recording device.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...tell us what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Levi continues to clutch the gun, staring out at the city Finally, in one swift movement, he raises it to his head fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew leans into the light...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, first, I wanna know I have immunity. Mike looks around.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sir, we actually can't promise that at this time, but I assure you, that your cooperation will favor you in court sentencing-

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: -What if I told you that I could help bring in another person too...someone you might be very interested in bringing in. Would that give me immunity?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two SUV's parked in the middle of the desert. A a moment, we see Andrew get out of one of the cars. He walks out into the middle of the two cars and waits fo moment, until the doors of the other car open and out ste Tan'el and his assistant. Andrew flashes a huge fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: My favorite broker! Andrew tosses them a duffle bag...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Ten million. Back like we told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man! And don't think I won't want to invest with you guys again.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't think that's gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm quitting the business. Moving away for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: TAN'EL
dialogues.text: Too bad. Well, I hope you live a good life my friend.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You as well. They shake and Andrew turns and heads back to his car. He gets in as Tan'el wanders back to his car. Andrew peels out and dust flies up. Before Tan'el is even the car, Andrew is already booking out of there. Finally, Andrew's car is about fifty yards away, WE SEE FOUR BLACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan'el looks around, scared, not knowing what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is in shotgun of one of the cars, staring straight a clenching his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly move in on a hill of dirt...and see that next t is a big hole...where Heather and Andrew buried the one m dollars in cash...it's gone now. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew lets out a scream of excitement. Heather appears the backseat, she was ducking down.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: We did it baby!

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Home free, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just gotta find where that home is now. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Well, what are you thinking...Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Can we afford Vegas? Heather reveals the duffle bag with the one million dolla cash...

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: We got about one million, so how long can that last in Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I guess we'll find out. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: WATCH THEM DISAPPEAR INTO THE DISTANCE.
dialogues.text: We hear a voice over from an earlier scene as they drive and we see the desert, old west landscape...

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Welcome to the twenty-first century, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Feels good.

dialogues.speaker: LEVI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is our time. This is our time to define what the twenty-first century is going to represent. Wecan shape it.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first outlaws of the new millenium.
